physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 46-year-old female with severe ocular surface inflammation, conjunctivitis, membranes, filaments, and inferior forniceal symblephara involving both eyes with forniceal foreshortening. Visual acuities: 20/40 (right), 20/70 (left).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially diagnosed with conjunctivitis and dry eye, treatment with topical medications did not resolve symptoms. Ocular inflammation improved significantly after systemic steroid therapy post-biopsy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 54-year-old male with worsening vision, increased eye irritation, eyelid margin thickening, conjunctival thickening, mucus discharge, extensive symblephara with forniceal foreshortening. Visual acuities: 20/100 (right), 20/30 (left).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ocular findings worsened over time with the onset of oral lesions and skin involvement, including ulcerated lesions in multiple areas.
